fields.description:
The cloud-request.log records the full content for POST requests:

{code}
Fri Apr 25 15:19:53 2014 99bf2e61-a56e-477b-8f08-da2f97aa3eff arn:aws:euare::525566742355:user/admin /10.8.0.122:50636 /10.111.5.153:8773 compute DescribeKeyPairsType [POST,<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:ns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-05-01/" xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">

fpSOYmALIs5wM030/oBY0PhjbGc8Tuo/o/kNJeRl1zp+L87xrHtA0OdhEQMLUCL/U4TVRXs+4MBt
hwzOJtK4mZFpZzToavM=</ds:SignatureValue><ds:KeyInfo Id="KI-37E65DC57C41535720139846439386623"><wsse:SecurityTokenReference wsu:Id="STR-37E65DC57C41535720139846439386624"><wsse:Reference URI="#X509-37E65DC57C41535720139846439386622" ValueType="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3"/></wsse:SecurityTokenReference></ds:KeyInfo></ds:Signature><wsu:Timestamp wsu:Id="TS-19"><wsu:Created>2014-04-25T22:19:53.865Z</wsu:Created><wsu:Expires>2014-04-25T22:24:53.865Z</wsu:Expires></wsu:Timestamp></wsse:Security></soapenv:Header>
   <soapenv:Body wsu:Id="id-20" xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd">

   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>]
Fri Apr 25 15:19:54 2014 99bf2e61-a56e-477b-8f08-da2f97aa3eff arn:aws:euare::525566742355:user/admin /10.8.0.122:50636 /10.111.5.153:8773 compute DescribeKeyPairsResponseType [200 OK]
{code}

This user requests and also for requests between system components when the services are on separate hosts.
fields.summary: Request log records full contents for POST requests (SOAP messages, etc)

comments.body: I'm unsure on the goal of this ticket but I'd like to add that during development of this feature there was a time when the request log would just dump the API action.  Users would like to see this back; perhaps it becomes INFO vs DEBUG.  DEBUG being the full content of the request...
[~shashi], we need additional customer use case data before we can move on this item.

Bodies of POST requests should never been logged because they are potentially very large and because they might contain sensitive information. To fix the security issue, we should just stop logging POST bodies. If we need to match CloudTrail functionality, it looks like we need to parse info out of the bodies similar to the Steve's example.

Hi [~rusvika]

I'm working on implementing this change in 4.1.1.

I agree with you that we shouldn't log POST requests, although there are times that we need access to the raw request. I'd like to propose that we disable logging of POST requests for all levels except for TRACE. My reasoning is as follows:
* There are rare times when we need full access to what is being passed back and forth between the client and the components.
* The only time TRACE would be enabled, is in an environment that is not functioning correctly (nobody runs in production with TRACE). At that point, logging POST requests becomes less of a security issue...as it is more important to get the cloud functional. 
* If we did disable this completely, and we really need this logging, we'll have to instrument code and ship a jar file to the customer. This isn't optimal as it will lead to a longer time to problem resolution and of course introduces other risks.

Let me know if disabling logging of POST requests except for TRACE levels is okay, and I'll make the change.

Thanks,
Steve

[~sgraham], TRACE is an acceptable solution, but is logging of full request truly necessary for debugging? Wouldn't using network sniffing tools (such as tcpdump) be sufficient for debugging component communications? If POST is used to transfer a large file, do we still want to log the entire request?

Hi [~rusvika]

Yes, it is important to be able to see the request in the system. When debugging/troubleshooting we'll get tcpdumps and debug/trace log levels and verify that the data is consistent along the path. It could turn out that the data looks "good" on the wire (as seen by a tcpdump), but then see that something  (in the process) is corrupting the POST data. The only way we can see that is by turning up the log levels.

-Steve
[~decker], please review if this is an appropriate change for 4.1.1 (remove logging of POST requests)

@sjones, sorry -- thought I had responded here already.  This all makes sense to me and looks good to go.  FWIW, reading back I notice:

* CloudTrail is the right thing for the use case that justified cloud-requests.log -- too bad it was added in the release before that service was announced.  Lets not get too attached to it. I can't imagine justifying cloud-requests.log after a CloudTrail implementation.  Note: those who desire having cloud-requests.log can reinstall the handler on *their own cloud* should they so like.  
* POST requests which are large end up being chunked and won't hit the request logger (which takes only the HTTP message) be they SOAP or otherwise.  
* Sensitive information will invariable end up in this log without on-going grooming and filtering.

With that in mind, filtering, formatting, and delivery are whats missing from a cloud-requests.log's CloudTrail.  

Is cloud-requests.log set for the forseeable future? :)
Moved to 4.1.2. Fix looks good but we should ensure that Query API parameters that use POST are still logged.

Fix Verified.

Full contents of POST request is redacted in cloud-request.log

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.2
Release     : 0.0.23231.102.20150707git35ff392.el6

Example of request log entry for a request (DescribeKeypairs)
{code}
Tue Jul 7 11:53:34 2015 36049e73-0785-49ba-9e92-3f480c023d76::0cefb41b-0787-4742-9b8b-bef70f9c3c7b arn:aws:euare::920214462380:user/admin /10.111.1.107:59380 /10.111.1.94:8773 eucalyptus DescribeKeyPairsType [POST,--REDACTED--]
Tue Jul 7 11:53:34 2015 36049e73-0785-49ba-9e92-3f480c023d76::0cefb41b-0787-4742-9b8b-bef70f9c3c7b arn:aws:euare::920214462380:user/admin /10.111.1.107:59380 /10.111.1.94:8773 eucalyptus DescribeKeyPairsResponseType [200 OK]
{code}
